intro: Notelaea eucleoides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hakea, is a shrub native to the south-western region of Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and dense, cylindrical flower spikes. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native habitat. It produces bright yellow flowers that attract nectar-feeding birds and insects, contributing to its ecological significance. Notelaea eucleoides is also valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
